You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Salesforce B2B Commerce for Visualforce

Implement your B2B solution with a set of Visualforce pages and components, installed from a managed package and integrated with your Experience Cloud site. Admins can manage storefront metadata, product catalogs, and certain buyer-facing features from a set of custom objects and custom settings. You can configure the default options to suit various simple or complex B2B use cases. Because the storefront is built on Visualforce, developers can extend or override the default functionality throughout the application and fine-tune storefront behavior.

REQUIRED EDITIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)
TIP
Salesforce has moved all content from the external CloudCraze wiki to an appropriate location in Salesforce Help. Some content is available only as an archived PDF, which is linked from the appropriate topic in Salesforce Help. For a complete review of all migrated content, and to help you update your bookmarks, see the Salesforce Knowledge article, Find CloudCraze Documentation.
Some content, such as Handlebars templates reference and more details about the service layer architecture in the API, is restricted to approved users only. To request access, complete the steps in the Salesforce Knowledge article, Request access to the secured documentation for B2B Commerce for Visualforce.
Get Started with B2B Commerce for Visualforce
Are you excited to start using B2B Commerce in your org? Well, good news! It’s easy to set up an org, install the managed package, and begin tinkering. As always, the details are important. To make sure that your B2B Commerce trail is a breeze, carefully review these steps as you begin.
Manage Storefront Details and Metadata
For each storefront in your org, you can easily configure certain settings and behaviors, and maintain the data that powers your storefront content and experiences.
Set Up Product Data for B2B Commerce for Visualforce
Products are the reason why buyers visit your storefront, create accounts, and make purchases, and why they return frequently to make new purchases. To that end, create product data in your org that is rich with details like media and performance or measurement specifications.
Help Buyers Discover Products on Your Storefront
Your storefront is successful only when your buyers can easily find and purchase products that they're interested in. To support a smooth buyer experience, you can provide multiple channels throughout your storefront for organizing, filtering, and displaying product information.
Price and Sell Products for B2B Commerce for Visualforce
Motivate buyers to purchase products from your storefront. Showcase your most popular products, offer discounts, set up special pricing strategies, and allow buyers to easily track the items they're interested in.
Support Buyer Accounts for B2B Commerce for Visualforce
Equip buyers and other storefront users with tools for accessing storefront content and managing their accounts.
Provide a Smooth Path to Purchase for Storefront Buyers
Give a buyer an intuitive, trusted experience as they create a shopping cart, check out, confirm an order, and generate an invoice. As admin, you have several options for configuring different parts of the purchase experience to satisfy your project's requirements. You can define the experience for both guest and registered buyers, including restricting guest buyers from certain functionality.
Customize the Storefront User Experience
You can tailor a buyer’s shopping experience on your B2B Commerce for Visualforce storefront to suit your organization's requirements. The managed package provides several options for controlling page layouts, adding widgets to pages, customizing the look and feel of your storefront, and more.
Strategize for Storefront Success
Often, your storefront strategy requires a complex support environment, including multiple orgs for development and production, multiple Experience Cloud sites, and localized content for different regions. How do you manage all of these competing demands? How do you attract traffic to and measure traffic through your storefronts?
Deliver Storefront Performance and Security
Optimize your storefront to meet performance requirements, even as your data volume expands and your traffic increases. Secure the data moving to and from your org, and ensure that your storefront remains protected against unexpected vulnerabilities.
Market Templates for B2B Commerce for Visualforce
Expand the capabilities of the default B2B Commerce for Visualforce managed package with add-on packages, known as market templates. The CyberSource for B2B Commerce template adds a CyberSource Secure Acceptance payment gateway and tokenization service for processing credit card transactions during checkout. The legacy Avalara AvaTax for B2B Commerce template—which has been discontinued—adds real-time tax quotation.
Solution Resources for B2B Commerce for Visualforce
Not every B2B Commerce for Visualforce implementation is the same, and some use cases have significant data volumes and robust operational requirements. To keep your storefronts and orgs healthy and happy, review the following tip sheets for guidance on how to successfully scale your B2B Commerce solution.
